description: Minimal number with binary order n which has maximal number of divisors in this interval.
comments: Compare with A007416, where terms of this sequence are present.
example: For n=9, with 256<x<=512, d[ x ] takes 17 distinct values, of which d[ x ]=24 is the greatest (see A036451 and A036470) and occurs first at x=360, so a(9)=360.
mathematica: ld[ x_ ] := Length[ Divisors[ x ] ]; a=1+2^(n-1), b=2^n; List=Flatten[ Position[ Table[ ld[ x ], {x, a, b} ], max{ld[ x ]} ]+a-1 ]; Min{List}=A036484
author: _Labos Elemer_
